question: The tSNE plots above have changed their shape a lot by increasing the perplexity. What does the perplexity parameter controls?

answers.answer: How much the neighborhood of each point stretches to include other points
answers.feedback: Correct! A small perplexity will consider only small neighbourhoods, giving privilege to the local data structure and not the global one. This is why a perplexity of 1 gives rise to a blob of points.

answers.answer: The number of dimensions to include in the projection from the high-dimensional data
The speed to determine the embedding using PCA
The balance between local and global structure when calculating similarities between points.
answers.feedback: Yes! A higher perplexity will consider similarities also for points more far away, keeping more of the global structure of the data in the projection.
